required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Respiratory Rehabilitation by Gender in COPD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Pulmonary Rehabilitation According to Gender, in COPD Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Without calling into question the effectiveness of pulmonary rehabilitation in women, the difference in outcome by gender was not established due to insufficient evidence .
Studies demonstrating the effectiveness of pulmonary rehabilitation include a majority of men, which no longer corresponds to the sex ratio of the disease. The impact of gender on pulmonary rehabilitation outcomes was not established due to insufficient evidence.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline Dyspnea-12 score at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Dyspnea-12 allows to evaluate sensori and emotional dyspnea

study_pop.textblock: COPD patients undergoing a pulmonary rehabilitation program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient > 18 years old
- No opposition filed
- Patient with COPD
- Completed participation in respiratory rehabilitation program
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of participation
- Patient under tutorship or curatorship
- No final assessment
- Patients with sex changes in marital status

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected data that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available beginning 6 Months and ending five years following the publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access requests will be reviewed by the internal committee of Brest UH. Requestors will be required to sign and complete a data access agreement.
